common_issues.title: Pieces OS Copilot struggles to access and read files
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS Copilot encountering difficulties in accessing and reading files, leading to inaccurate code suggestions and requiring manual copy-pasting. The issue appears to stem from problems with Pieces OS versions, potential bugs in file integration, and LTM activation issues. Solutions include updating Pieces OS, reinstalling the application, and ongoing bug fixes from the Pieces team.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS 11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So until about a weekish ago, Everything would work smoothly, except for some other issues that did annoy me, but I had workarounds for them. Those issues was pieces os not working after a while. Not a big deal since I would just close it in task manager and reopen it once it was all closed to force a hard restart of the whole system. But, now (thanks for listening to my little rant up there) there is an issue that I cannot workaround. For some reason pieces cannot get any context from any files or folders, and its getting pretty annoying to the fact that I have started using other softwares because at least they can look at the files and suggest changes or edits that actually have something to do with my code. I believe this happened ever since i updated pieces os about 2-3 updates ago, but cannot pinpoint any specific cause. Another cause may be that fact that I downloaded Ollama but never really used it.
## GitHub Issue Summary

**Issue:** Files in GitHub Copilot are not being read correctly, requiring users to copy and paste code into chat.

**Key points:**

* Issue reported by RamanBaig on Jan 2nd, 2025.
* Occurs with both Claude and gpt models.
* Affects all folders and files.
* Long term memory is enabled.
* User is running Windows 11 Home.

**Problems identified:**

* Copilot cannot read file contents directly.
* Users have to manually copy and paste code into chat, which is inefficient.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Sam-at-pieces requests additional information to reproduce the issue.
* RamanBaig provides details on their system and files.
* Sam-at-pieces suggests scheduling a call to further diagnose the problem.
* Mark-at-pieces offers to assist with the call and provides their calendar link.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Issue remains unresolved, but a call with Sam-at-pieces or Mark-at-pieces is scheduled to investigate further.

**Additional Notes:**

* Sam-at-pieces mentions potential bug fixes that may resolve the issue.

[https://disk.yandex.ru/i/Z_U0FzYA8NBrNg](url)
There is a video here that describes the problem
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Long-Term Memory Engine Not Activating

**Key Points Raised:**

* User @Iliya3ProX reported an issue where Long-Term Memory Engine (LTM) was not activating.
* User provided a video showcasing the problem.
* Issue was confirmed and investigated by the Pieces team.
* Problem was identified as a bug where downloaded LLM state overrides saved selected model.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team provided troubleshooting steps to gather logs.
* Issue was fixed and a patch released (version 11.0.1 of PiecesOS and 3.3.1 of Desktop App).
* User confirmed issue persisted after update.
* Further investigation revealed Qdrant dependency failing to boot.
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and indicated it would be resolved by updating database infrastructure.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue still ongoing for some users including @Iliya3ProX and @AyomideA-S.
* Database infrastructure update is in progress.
* Alternative solution provided for @Iliya3ProX by reinstalling Pieces from the Microsoft Store.

**Additional Notes:**

* User @Iliya3ProX reported an issue with PyCharm plugin crashing after update.
* User @Iliya3ProX also inquired about high idle time expense on their machine.

**Overall, the issue with LTM not activating has been identified and a fix is in progress. However, some users are still experiencing the issue. The Pieces team is actively working to resolve it.**

common_issues.title: Long-Term Memory (LTM) Feature Issues on Linux
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature on Linux, particularly with Wayland. Some users report LTM not working at all, while others have issues with specific functionalities. Proposed solutions include switching to x11 as a temporary workaround, providing log files for troubleshooting, and addressing dependency failures. The Pieces team is actively investigating and working on resolving these issues.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation Regarding Long-Term Memory Feature

**Key Points:**

* Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature is in testing on Linux for x11.
* Issues with Wayland support.
* LTM doesn't function for some users, including Michael-Obele and scotch86.
* Dependencies for LTM engine may be failing to boot on affected devices.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM not working on Wayland.
* Feature not functioning for some users on x11.
* LTM engine dependency failure.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Switching to x11 (temporary workaround).
* Providing log files for troubleshooting.
* Scheduling live video call for further troubleshooting.
* Deprecating the failing dependency (long-term solution).

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Live video troubleshooting scheduled for Thursday.
* Issue acknowledged and under investigation.
* LTM engine dependency failure being addressed.

**Additional Notes:**

* Link to similar issue provided: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/553
* Update on deprecation shared in linked issue.

related_issues.title: Obsidian Plugin
related_issues.text:
Obsidian Plugin
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hi! I'm attempting to get the Pieces for Devs Obsidian plugin to work. The installation of the Pieces for Devs " Pieces for Obsidian plugin" goes seemingly faultless as it reports in green: " Pieces for Obsidian plugin installed successfully". 

 However, as soon as I attempt to enable the plugin (v1.21.1)the following error pops up ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”. 
- Obsidian v1.7.7 is up to date, and running. 
- Pieces OS v11.0.3 is running, and 
- Pieces for Devs Desktop is up and running @ v3.3.3. 
- The OS is Windows 10 Pro 64 bit Version 22H2, Build 19045.5247 updated 02-02-2025

I have followed the guidelines in the following documentation (https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian). The install fails with a not-very-helpful answer. ”Failed to load plugin ‘pieces-for-developers’”

Referring to the section "https://docs.pieces.app/extensions-plugins/obsidian#having-trouble-with-the-pieces-for-developers-obsidian-plugin" in the documentation still fails to provide the expected results, so the next step would be to attempt to find related installation logs that might shed light on the issue.

I've searched for possible issues indicating this type of bug/issue but none were found here on GitHub.
I had a look at the `obsidian.log` file in the `C:\Users\[user]\AppData\Roaming\obsidian` folder but there's no indication at all nor any mention of any plugins or installations related to such.

Repeat uninstall/reinstall advice does not resolve the problem either.
Could you indicate which other Pieces, Obsidian and Win-OS logs would be the most appropriate to investigate which might shed light on the cause, please?

**Edit:**
I'm using other plugins without any issues.
![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/19b3dcd2-05fa-4171-ae2e-dc71b5ce451c)

Thank you for looking into this.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Andre-ADPC is experiencing issues with the Pieces for Obsidian plugin.
* Bishoy-at-pieces requests Andre to share console logs to diagnose the problem.

**Problems identified:**

* Andre-ADPC misunderstands the request for console logs, asking for clarification.
* The specific console in question (Obsidian's developer console) is not explicitly specified. 

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Bishoy-at-pieces clarifies the request, explaining how to access the relevant console and providing a reference link.
* Bishoy-at-pieces also provides a screenshot highlighting the specific tab to be captured in the console logs.

**Current status/outcome:**

* It is unclear whether Andre-ADPC provided the console logs or if the issue was resolved.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation demonstrates the importance of clear communication and providing specific instructions.

related_issues.title: Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
related_issues.text:
Announcement: 11.0.0 POS Breaking Change - TLDR: please update all plugins
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS, Web Extension, JetBrains, VS Code, Visual Studio, Obsidian, JupyterLab, Sublime Plugin, Raycast Extension, Pieces CLI, Neovim

### Operating System / Platform

macOS/Windows/Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

Hey 👋,

We introduce one of the largest releases in the Pieces Ecosystem.

Lots of bug fixes - targeting some of the largest hitches in the user journey to name a few: rate limiting(authenticate to bypass, + better error messaging), entirely new Ollama (local LLM) infrastructure w/ in the copilot, and tackling installation head-on.

The detailed list of changes is not quite ready yet; however, it will be here shortly. (I will post them here when they are)

However, this issue is here let you know to update all your plugins and provide the status of all of the new plugins(in the case they are not yet out in production)

Pieces For Developers(Desktop Application): 3.3.0 - Live
PiecesOs: 11.0.0 - Live
vscode: 2.0.0 - Live
JetBrains: 11.0.0 - Live
Visual Studio: 4.0.0 - Live
Jupyter: 1.21.0 - Live
Obsidian: 1.21.0 - Live
Sublime: 1.5.0 - Live
CLI: - 1.9.0 Live
NeoVim: - 1.3.0 Live
Chrome(web) Extension: - 4.0.0 (This is under review)

Please, if you have any questions about the release or are having trouble updating to the latest, comment in this thread, and we can help you out!!
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* Browser extension blinking like disco upon OS restart. (Pixel-Staff-01)
* Browser opening automatically on every OS restart. (luckycreationsindia)
* Browser popup urging plugin updates even when outdated plugins are not installed. (seantiz)
* JetBrains plugin showing incorrect version information. (luckycreationsindia)

**Problems identified:**

* Annoying browser extension blinking.
* Unnecessary browser opening on OS restart.
* Misleading browser popup about plugin updates.
* Incorrect JetBrains plugin version information.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Update outdated plugins to remove the browser extension blinking and popup. (mark-at-pieces)
* Disable automatic browser opening on OS restart in the next PiecesOS update. (mark-at-pieces)
* Investigate robust cleanup processes for non-existent plugins. (seantiz)
* Address the version information issue with the JetBrains plugin. (mark-at-pieces)

**Current status/outcome:**

* The browser extension blinking and popup should be resolved by updating outdated plugins.
* Automatic browser opening on OS restart will be disabled in the next PiecesOS update.
* Robust cleanup processes for non-existent plugins are under consideration.
* The JetBrains plugin version information issue requires further investigation.

**Additional notes:**

* The JetBrains plugin issue might be related to a known bug in the pieces-app/os_server repository (issue #1476).
* Re-opening the extension side panel might temporarily resolve the browser extension blinking issue.
* Screenshots of the issues would be helpful in troubleshooting.

This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation Regarding Long-Term Memory Feature

**Key Points:**

* Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature is in testing on Linux for x11.

* LTM doesn't function for some users, including Michael-Obele and scotch86.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues in Remote Environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from remote environments, particularly within Docker containers. This is often due to port access issues and changes in Pieces OS's default listening address. Solutions include upgrading to the latest Pieces OS and VS Code plugin versions, which offer automatic environment detection and eliminate the need for custom URLs.  If problems persist, contacting support for further troubleshooting is recommended.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation - Connecting from Dev Container issue ## **Key Points:** * User reported an issue connecting to Pieces OS from a Dev Container using a VSCode extension and custom URL. * The error message suggested an issue with port access. **Problems Identified:** * Pieces OS default server listening address changed to loopback in newer versions, which caused connection issues for Dev Containers using custom URLs. * Docker mounts accessed localhost via "host.docker.internal" resolution, causing problems with Copilot webview tool windows which couldn't resolve the internal address. **Solutions:** * Patch to the VSCode plugin to detect Pieces OS automatically and remove the need for custom URLs * Complex workaround involving creating a "pieceshost" entry in both container and host to resolve "host.docker.internal" to localhost **Implemented Solution:** * Patch v2.0.1 of the VSCode plugin released, removing the need for custom URLs **Current Status:** * User confirmed issue persists despite plugin update * Developer suggested scheduling a video call to troubleshoot further. **Outcome:** * Issue resolution pending further troubleshooting * Potential solution involves a video call between user and developer **Additional Points:** * This issue was reported in December 2024 and discussed through January 2025. * The user's specific environment includes Docker and the Pieces OS plugin for VSCode.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation **Key Points Raised:** * The recent Pieces OS update allows users to run the OS on any port, causing the developer tool extension to fail attempts to connect and flooding the console with error logs * User concerns about the console becoming cluttered and difficult to use for real errors **Problems Identified:** * The tool's attempt to connect to Pieces OS causes unnecessary error logs in dev tool * Cluttering of the console makes troubleshooting real problems difficult **Proposed and Implemented Solutions:** * Hide the inactive port check errors or handle them better to avoid cluttering the dev tool (proposed by @rutvik110) * Fix expected in a patch update for the extension the following week (estimated time) **Current Status/Outcome:** * Further research found the problem may be a Chrome bug * No definite fix for bug currently, alternative suggestion for users to utilize "Hide Network Messages" in dev tools * Outcome: No permanent fix, user workaround available **Additional Notes:** * User acknowledges importance of the issue and expresses willingness to wait for fix * Developer team actively investigating and looking for solutions

* Updating to PiecesOS 11.0.3 or later should resolve the issue.

* This issue was causing frustration and impacting workflow.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Reinstall Pieces and PiecesOS if unable to update.

recommendations: **Prioritize LTM Issues:** Allocate resources to address the recurring issues with the Long-Term Memory (LTM) feature, particularly on Linux and with database migration challenges.
**Improve Plugin Integration:** Investigate and resolve issues with Pieces OS plugin integration, focusing on Obsidian and ensuring compatibility with different versions.
**Enhance Remote Environment Support:** Provide clearer documentation and solutions for users experiencing connection issues in remote environments, especially within Docker containers.
**Address File Access Problems:** Investigate and fix the root cause of Pieces OS Copilot struggling to access and read files, which leads to inaccurate code suggestions.

**Monitor Common Error Messages:** Analyze and address common error messages, such as "'I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing. Please...'" and "ApiException 500: Format Metrics snapshot failed.", to improve user experience and streamline troubleshooting.
